sources.source_name: Washington Secretary of State - Corporations Division
Washington Secretary of State - Charities Program

incorporation_agency: Washington Secretary of State - Corporations Division
charitable_registration_agency: Washington Secretary of State - Charities Program
exemption_threshold_note: Organizations with gross receipts under $50,000 annually may be exempt from registration. However, organizations intending to solicit must still register even if below threshold.

formation_requirements.filing_agency: Washington Secretary of State - Corporations Division
formation_requirements.notes: Washington requires a registered agent with a Washington address. Filing fee of $30 is very affordable. Online filing available through Corporations Online system.

requirements.filing_agency: Washington Secretary of State - Corporations Division
requirements.due_date_specifics: Due by the end of the month preceding the anniversary month (e.g., if incorporated in May, due by April 30)
required_information: Names and addresses of officers and directors
requirements.notes: Filing fee is only $10, one of the lowest in the nation. No late fee but administrative dissolution possible if two consecutive years are missed.

requirements.filing_agency: Washington Secretary of State - Charities Program
required_information: Copy of Articles of Incorporation or organizing documents
Financial statements for most recent fiscal year
requirements.notes: Registration is FREE for charitable organizations. Organizations intending to solicit must register even if under $50,000 threshold. Registration is required before soliciting.

requirements.filing_agency: Washington Secretary of State - Charities Program
requirements.due_date_specifics: Within 4.5 months after fiscal year end (or 6 months if filing IRS extension)
required_information: Washington Schedule of Contributions and Expenses
Updated list of officers and directors
requirements.notes: Annual renewal is FREE with no late fees. Due within 4.5 months of fiscal year end (6 months if IRS extension filed). Failure to file may result in suspension.

requirements.due_date_specifics: Obtain after receiving IRS 501(c)(3) determination letter
required_information: Request for letter ruling on specific exemptions
requirements.notes: Washington provides various sales tax exemptions for nonprofits. Organizations should request a letter ruling for specific exemptions. Not all purchases are automatically exempt.

requirements.due_date_specifics: File by September 1st of assessment year for following tax year
requirements.form_number: Form 62-A001 - Application for Property Tax Exemption
required_information: Description of property use for charitable purposes
requirements.notes: Property must be owned by nonprofit and used exclusively for charitable purposes. Initial application required by September 1st. Once granted, exemption continues if use remains qualifying.

requirements.due_date_specifics: License valid for one year from issue date
required_information: Proof of 12+ months operation in Washington
List of officers and gambling managers
requirements.notes: Washington requires gambling license for raffles and other games of chance. Organization must be in existence for 12+ months. Annual reporting required. Prize limits apply.

requirements.due_date_specifics: License valid for one year from issue date
required_information: Proof of 12+ months operation in Washington
List of officers and bingo managers
requirements.notes: Bingo license for regular operations. Quarterly activity reports required. Strict operational and prize rules apply.

requirements.filing_agency: Washington Secretary of State - Charities Program
requirements.due_date_specifics: Renewed annually from initial registration date
requirements.notes: Required for paid commercial fundraisers. Each contract must be filed within 10 days. Bond must remain in effect. Campaign reports required.

requirements.filing_agency: Washington Secretary of State - Charities Program
requirements.due_date_specifics: Renewed annually from initial registration date
requirements.notes: Fundraising counsel provides consulting but does not solicit or handle contributions. No bond required. Each contract must be filed.

requirements.filing_agency: Internal requirement - filed with board and may be required for annual renewal
requirements.due_date_specifics: Within 135 days after fiscal year end (completed before annual renewal)
requirements.notes: Washington does not legally mandate audits based solely on revenue, but best practices suggest audits for organizations over $500,000. Federal Single Audit rules may require audits for federal grant recipients.

special_notes.free_charity_filing: Washington provides FREE charitable registration and annual renewal with NO late fees, making it one of the most nonprofit-friendly states for compliance costs.
special_notes.no_state_income_tax: Washington has no state income tax, so organizations do not need to file state income tax exemption applications or returns (except for UBIT).
special_notes.low_corporate_fees: Washington's $30 incorporation fee and $10 annual report fee are among the lowest nationally, reducing barriers to nonprofit formation.
special_notes.intent_to_solicit: Washington requires registration for organizations intending to solicit, even if under the $50,000 threshold. This is broader than some states.
special_notes.board_requirements: Washington nonprofit corporations must have at least three directors. Directors need not be Washington residents.
special_notes.twelve_month_gaming: Washington requires only 12 months (1 year) of operation before charitable gambling, shorter than many states requiring 3-5 years.
special_notes.political_activity_limits: 501(c)(3) organizations must comply with federal restrictions on political campaign intervention and lobbying.
special_notes.professional_fundraiser_contracts: All contracts with commercial fundraisers or fundraising counsel must be filed with the Charities Program within 10 days.
special_notes.gambling_commission: Washington has a dedicated Gambling Commission that oversees all charitable gambling. Regulations are comprehensive and actively enforced.
special_notes.property_tax_deadline: Property tax exemption applications must be filed by September 1st of the assessment year for the following tax year.
special_notes.dissolution_requirements: Upon dissolution, assets must be distributed to organizations with similar charitable purposes. Secretary of State should be notified.
special_notes.unrelated_business_income: Organizations with unrelated business income over $1,000 must file IRS Form 990-T. Washington B&O tax may also apply to UBIT.
special_notes.online_systems: Washington has excellent online filing systems for both corporate filings and charitable registration, making compliance efficient.
